treatments.name: New Patient Consultation and Treatment Plan
treatments.desc: New patient consultation is a complete assessment of dental health. X-rays and a full treatment plan are provided. An annual recall date will be discussed and you will have the opportunity to book your first treatment. The consultation includes mouth cancer screening and a full mouth review for hygiene treatments which last 3 years.

treatments.name: Repeat Examination
treatments.desc: During your Dental Examination: the Dentist will ask how your general health is, you can discuss f you have any problems or areas of concern. They will look in your mouth and carry out an examination of your teeth, gums and mouth. They will discuss their findings and advise of any necessary treatments required, they may take x-rays if they feel you require them. We do not charge extra for X-rays during your examination. The Dentist ask about your health if you are on any medications, lifestyle and provide any advice on diet, smoking, alcohol and teeth cleaning to help improve your oral health. They will also inform you of when you should visit for your next check-up, this could be anywhere between 3 months to 12 months depending on your needs.

treatments.name: Mouth Cancer screening
treatments.desc: More people die of mouth cancer than testicular or cervical cancer. It kills one person every five hours in the UK and affects more people than testicular and ovarian cancer combined. Treatment for mouth cancer has a far higher rate of success if the cancer is detected early. In order to raise awareness of this cancer and to help you spot the signs earlier, we offer mouth cancer screening at just  £20 – £1 from every screen is donated to Mouth Cancer Awareness. If you are anxious about seeing a dentist for a standard check up but would like to be screened for mouth cancer then book in to see one of our friendly dentists. They will do nothing more than just the screening to put your mind at ease. Do not be afraid , get it checked out. Nationally Mouth Cancer is in the top ten of most commonly diagnosed cancers accounting for more than 7,800 new cases per year.

treatments.name: Veneers
treatments.desc: A veneer is a thin layer of porcelain made to fit over the front surface of a tooth, like a false fingernail fits over a nail. They can cover worn tooth enamel, uneven tooth alignment or spacing and chips or cracks. They improve the colour, shape and can be used to improve the position of the tooth in your mouth creating a brighter, whiter smile.

treatments.name: Crowns
treatments.desc: A crown is like a jacket that encases a tooth and they can be made in a number of materials dependant on the strength required, and the look wanted. They are suggested when a tooth is broken or a large filling needs replacing. A crown can also be used to improve the appearance of a large discoloured filling. The crown preparation is sent to a laboratory where the skill of the technician is paramount in creating a tooth in one of three materials.

treatments.name: Inlays
treatments.desc: Inlays replace fillings within the biting surface of a tooth. These are made in conjunction with a laboratory and your dentist. They are specially made out of porcelain or gold and fit like a jigsaw piece into the shape of the filling.

treatments.name: Bridges
treatments.desc: Bridges are used to fill the gaps of missing teeth and are only possible if the tooth is strong enough and has good enough bone support. Bridges are made in the laboratory following preparation work done by your dentist in the surgery. They are usually made out of porcelain bonded onto precious metal. There are also new bridges made entirely of a special type of strong porcelain.

treatments.name: Implants
treatments.desc: A dental implant is essentially a substitute for a natural root and commonly it is screw or cylinder shaped. Once fitted, these components provide the foundation for long-term support of crowns, bridges or dentures. Indistinguishable from natural teeth, they provide reliable alternatives to uncomfortable dentures or bridgework, or a single implant can simply replace a single missing tooth.

treatments.name: Root Canal Therapy
treatments.desc: RCT cleans and disinfects the canal of the tooth from the inside. The canals are then filled to prevent the infection from recurring. An alternative to RCT is extraction.

treatments.name: Fillings
treatments.desc: Teeth can be filled with gold; porcelain; silver amalgam (which consists of mercury mixed with silver, tin, zinc, and copper); or tooth-colored, plastic, and materials called composite resin fillings. There is also a material that contains glass particles and is known as glass ionomer.

treatments.name: Composite Bonding
treatments.desc: A white filling material can be added to the teeth to create a fuller look. Using a special composite bonding technique, your dentist can close these gaps improving the integrity of the gum and the appearance of your smile. This s a minimally invasive & cost effective treatment , no injections needed. These gaps are filled with a composite ( highly polished white filling materials) matched to the shade of your teeth. This is then shaped and polished to give a beautiful shine that is smooth to the touch.

treatments.name: Fissure Sealants
treatments.desc: Fissure sealants are plastic coats that are applied to the biting surface of your back teeth, like a nail varnish that coats the surfaces and protects them from bacteria and decay. They are normally applied to children’s teeth when their first molars come through at the age of six but can be applied to adult teeth as well.

treatments.name: Custom-made Sport Guards
treatments.desc: A custom sports guard is a revolutionary piece of protective gear that protects the teeth, and jaw from impact and injury during sports activities. These sports guards cushion blows that could cause injury. They can reduce the rate of concussion as well as dental and mandibular injuries.

treatments.name: Surgical Extractions
treatments.desc: During the surgical extraction, the dentist makes an incision on a section of the gum tissue. This helps the dentist in getting access to bone tissue and the tooth which lies underneath. The dentists may also need to trim away the bone tissue for getting a better view of the tooth.

treatments.name: Dentures
treatments.desc: Tooth replacement for the upper or lower jaws. Dentures are custom-made to fit the specific oral measurements and condition. The appearance of dentures will also be bespoke to your smile, so your new teeth will look completely natural.

treatments.name: Invisalign
treatments.desc: Using the latest technology from Invisalign, this can be accomplished in as little as 2-9 months with this popular famous treatment to straighten your teeth the natural way. One of the most significant benefits from using Invisalign it’s practically invisible. The Invisalign system uses a series of clear, removable aligners to move your teeth week after week into its new and straighter position to give you the smile you’ve always wanted. It is fuss free, painless, removable, invisible with minimal maintenance needed.

treatments.name: Retainers
treatments.desc: Braces create a beautiful smile, but the retainer maintains it while encouraging better oral hygiene long after its use goes away. Although retainers for teeth are most commonly used to hold straight teeth in place after braces, the advantages for your kids in wearing their retainers correctly – per their orthodontist's orders – go beyond that. Did you know wearing a retainer can also help iron out speech problems? More than likely, though, the hardest part of having a new retainer is losing it, commonly to the trash can in the school cafeteria. Getting kids into the habit of wearing their retainer correctly and keeping it safe isn't easy, but knowing its advantages and how to make sure your kids embrace their retainers will help your whole family navigate the process with less stress – and higher marks from your orthodontist.
